author: James Martin
method: Spread the banana chunks out on a tray and transfer to the freezer. Leave the banana in the freezer until frozen all the way through (about one hour). Place the frozen banana chunks into a food processor. Add the vanilla, sugar, honey or sweetener and half of the buttermilk (or yoghurt). Turn on the processor and blend for a few moments. Then, while the processor is still running, pour in the remaining buttermilk in a thin, steady stream (if you are using yoghurt, just tip it all in and blend). Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Serve at once.
ingredients: 4 very ripe bananas, peeled, cut into chunks ,  ¼ tsp vanilla essence,  3-4 tbsp sugar, honey or sweetener, to taste,  150ml/5fl oz buttermilk or 150g/5½oz Greek-style yoghurt
